# ZipVoice‚ö° ## Fast and High-Quality Zero-Shot Text-to-Speech with Flow Matching
## Overview

# ZipVoice‚ö° ## Flow Matching ile Hƒ±zlƒ± ve Y√ºksek Kaliteli Sƒ±fƒ±rdan Metinden Sese D√∂n√º≈ü√ºm
## Genel Bakƒ±≈ü

RowTranslations.originContent: ## Fast and High-Quality Zero-Shot Text-to-Speech with Flow Matching
RowTranslations.translatedContent: ## Flow Matching ile Hƒ±zlƒ± ve Y√ºksek Kaliteli Sƒ±fƒ±rdan Metinden Sese D√∂n√º≈ü√ºm

Content:
ZipVoice is a series of fast and high-quality zero-shot TTS models based on flow matching. ### 1. Key features - Small and fast: only 123M parameters. - High-quality voice cloning: state-of-the-art performance in speaker similarity, intelligibility, and naturalness. - Multi-lingual: support Chinese and English. - Multi-mode: support both single-speaker and dialogue speech generation. ### 2. Model variants
Model Name Description Paper Demo
ZipVoice The basic model supporting zero-shot single-speaker TTS in both Chinese and English.
ZipVoice-Distill The distilled version of ZipVoice, featuring improved speed with minimal performance degradation.
ZipVoice-Dialog A dialogue generation model built on ZipVoice, capable of generating single-channel two-party spoken dialogues.
Translation:
ZipVoice, flow matching tabanlƒ± hƒ±zlƒ± ve y√ºksek kaliteli sƒ±fƒ±r atƒ±≈ülƒ± TTS modellerinden olu≈üan bir seridir. ### 1. Temel √ñzellikler - K√º√ß√ºk ve hƒ±zlƒ±: yalnƒ±zca 123M parametre. - Y√ºksek kaliteli ses klonlama: konu≈ümacƒ± benzerliƒüi, anla≈üƒ±labilirlik ve doƒüallƒ±kta alanƒ±nda √∂nc√º performans. - √áok dilli: √áince ve ƒ∞ngilizce desteƒüi. - √áok modlu: hem tek konu≈ümacƒ±lƒ± hem de diyalog konu≈ümasƒ± √ºretimini destekler. ### 2. Model varyantlarƒ±
Model Adƒ± A√ßƒ±klama Makale Demo
ZipVoice √áince ve ƒ∞ngilizce'de sƒ±fƒ±r atƒ±≈ülƒ± tek konu≈ümacƒ±lƒ± TTS'yi destekleyen temel model.
ZipVoice-Distill ZipVoice‚Äôun damƒ±tƒ±lmƒ±≈ü s√ºr√ºm√º; minimum performans kaybƒ±yla geli≈ütirilmi≈ü hƒ±z sunar.
ZipVoice-Dialog ZipVoice √ºzerine kurulu, tek kanallƒ± iki taraflƒ± konu≈üma diyaloglarƒ± √ºretebilen bir diyalog √ºretim modeli.

Content: ZipVoice-Dialog-Stereo The stereo variant of ZipVoice-Dialog, enabling two-channel dialogue generation with each speaker assigned to a distinct channel. ## News **2025/07/14**: **ZipVoice-Dialog** and **ZipVoice-Dialog-Stereo**, two spoken dialogue generation models, are released. [![arXiv](https://img.shields.io/badge/arXiv-Paper-COLOR.svg)](https://arxiv.org/abs/2507.09318) [![demo page](https://img.shields.io/badge/GitHub.io-Demo_Page-blue?logo=Github&style=flat-square)](https://zipvoice-dialog.github.io) **2025/07/14**: **OpenDialog** dataset, a 6.8k-hour spoken dialogue dataset, is released. Download at [![hf](https://img.shields.io/badge/%F0%9F%A4%97%20HuggingFace-Dataset-yellow)](https://huggingface.co/datasets/k2-fsa/OpenDialog), [![ms](https://img.shields.io/badge/ModelScope-Dataset-blue?logo=data)](https://www.modelscope.cn/datasets/k2-fsa/OpenDialog). Check details at [![arXiv](https://img.shields.io/badge/arXiv-Paper-COLOR.svg)](https://arxiv.org/abs/2507.09318). **2025/06/16**: **ZipVoice** and **ZipVoice-Distill** are released. Content:
### 4. Install k2 for training or efficient inference

**k2 is necessary for training** and can speed up inference. Nevertheless, you can still use the inference mode of ZipVoice without installing k2.

> **Note:**  Make sure to install the k2 version that matches your PyTorch and CUDA version. For example, if you are using pytorch 2.5.1 and CUDA 12.1, you can install k2 as follows:
Translation:
### 4. Eƒüitim veya verimli √ßƒ±karƒ±m i√ßin k2'yi kurun

**k2 eƒüitim i√ßin gereklidir** ve √ßƒ±karƒ±mƒ± hƒ±zlandƒ±rabilir. Yine de, k2 y√ºklemeden ZipVoice'ƒ±n √ßƒ±karƒ±m modunu kullanabilirsiniz.

> **Not:**  Kullandƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±z PyTorch ve CUDA s√ºr√ºm√ºne uygun k2 s√ºr√ºm√ºn√º kurduƒüunuzdan emin olun. √ñrneƒüin, eƒüer pytorch 2.5.1 ve CUDA 12.1 kullanƒ±yorsanƒ±z, k2'yi ≈üu ≈üekilde kurabilirsiniz:

Content:
```bash
pip install k2==1.24.4.dev20250208+cuda12.1.torch2.5.1 -f https://k2-fsa.github.io/k2/cuda.html
```
Translation:
```bash
pip install k2==1.24.4.dev20250208+cuda12.1.torch2.5.1 -f https://k2-fsa.github.io/k2/cuda.html
```

Content:
## Usage

### 1. Single-speaker speech generation

To generate single-speaker speech with our pre-trained ZipVoice or ZipVoice-Distill models, use the following commands (Required models will be downloaded from HuggingFace):

#### 1.1 Inference of a single sentence
Translation:
## Kullanƒ±m

### 1. Tek konu≈ümacƒ±lƒ± konu≈üma √ºretimi

√ñnceden eƒüitilmi≈ü ZipVoice veya ZipVoice-Distill modellerimizle tek konu≈ümacƒ±lƒ± konu≈üma √ºretmek i√ßin a≈üaƒüƒ±daki komutlarƒ± kullanƒ±n (Gerekli modeller HuggingFace √ºzerinden indirilecektir):

#### 1.1 Tek bir c√ºmlenin √ßƒ±karƒ±mƒ±

Content:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice \
    --model-name zipvoice \
    --prompt-wav prompt.wav \
    --prompt-text "I am the transcription of the prompt wav." \
    --text "I am the text to be synthesized." \
    --res-wav-path result.wav
```
Translation:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice \
    --model-name zipvoice \
    --prompt-wav prompt.wav \
    --prompt-text "I am the transcription of the prompt wav." \
    --text "I am the text to be synthesized." \
    --res-wav-path result.wav
```

Content:
- `--model-name` can be `zipvoice` or `zipvoice_distill`, which are models before and after distillation, respectively.
- If `<>` or `[]` appear in the text, strings enclosed by them will be treated as special tokens. `<>` denotes Chinese pinyin and `[]` denotes other special tags.

#### 1.2 Inference of a list of sentences
Translation:
- `--model-name` deƒüeri `zipvoice` veya `zipvoice_distill` olabilir; bunlar sƒ±rasƒ±yla distilasyon √∂ncesi ve sonrasƒ± modellerdir.
- Eƒüer metinde `<>` veya `[]` g√∂r√ºn√ºrse, bunlar arasƒ±ndaki dizeler √∂zel belirte√ßler olarak kabul edilir. `<>` √áin pinyin'ini, `[]` ise diƒüer √∂zel etiketleri ifade eder.

#### 1.2 Bir c√ºmle listesinin √ßƒ±karƒ±mƒ±

RowTranslations.originContent: - `--model-name` can be `zipvoice` or `zipvoice_distill`, which are models before and after distillation, respectively.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `--model-name` deƒüeri `zipvoice` veya `zipvoice_distill` olabilir; bunlar sƒ±rasƒ±yla distilasyon √∂ncesi ve sonrasƒ± modellerdir.

RowTranslations.originContent: - If `<>` or `[]` appear in the text, strings enclosed by them will be treated as special tokens. `<>` denotes Chinese pinyin and `[]` denotes other special tags.
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - Eƒüer metinde `<>` veya `[]` g√∂r√ºn√ºrse, bunlar arasƒ±ndaki dizeler √∂zel belirte√ßler olarak kabul edilir. `<>` √áin pinyin'ini, `[]` ise diƒüer √∂zel etiketleri ifade eder.

RowTranslations.originContent: #### 1.2 Inference of a list of sentences

Content:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice \
    --model-name zipvoice \
    --test-list test.tsv \
    --res-dir results
```
Translation:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice \
    --model-name zipvoice \
    --test-list test.tsv \
    --res-dir results
```

Content:
- Each line of `test.tsv` is in the format of `{wav_name}\t{prompt_transcription}\t{prompt_wav}\t{text}`.

### 2. Dialogue speech generation

#### 2.1 Inference command

To generate two-party spoken dialogues with our pre-trained ZipVoice-Dialogue or ZipVoice-Dialogue-Stereo models, use the following commands (Required models will be downloaded from HuggingFace):
Translation:
- `test.tsv` dosyasƒ±nƒ±n her satƒ±rƒ± `{wav_name}\t{prompt_transcription}\t{prompt_wav}\t{text}` formatƒ±ndadƒ±r.

### 2. Diyalog konu≈üma √ºretimi

#### 2.1 √áƒ±karƒ±m komutu

√ñnceden eƒüitilmi≈ü ZipVoice-Dialogue veya ZipVoice-Dialogue-Stereo modellerimizle iki taraflƒ± konu≈ümalƒ± diyaloglar √ºretmek i√ßin a≈üaƒüƒ±daki komutlarƒ± kullanƒ±n (Gerekli modeller HuggingFace √ºzerinden indirilecektir):

Content:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_dialog \
    --model-name "zipvoice_dialog" \
    --test-list test.tsv \
    --res-dir results
```
Translation:
```bash
python3 -m zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_dialog \
    --model-name "zipvoice_dialog" \
    --test-list test.tsv \
    --res-dir results
```

Content:
- `--model-name` can be `zipvoice_dialog` or `zipvoice_dialog_stereo`,
    which generate mono and stereo dialogues, respectively.

#### 2.2 Input formats

Each line of `test.tsv` is in one of the following formats:

(1) **Merged prompt format** where the audios and transcriptions of two speakers prompts are merged into one prompt wav file:
Translation:
- `--model-name` `zipvoice_dialog` veya `zipvoice_dialog_stereo` olabilir,
    sƒ±rasƒ±yla mono ve stereo diyaloglar √ºretir.

#### 2.2 Girdi formatlarƒ±

`test.tsv` dosyasƒ±ndaki her satƒ±r a≈üaƒüƒ±daki formatlardan birindedir:

(1) **Birle≈ütirilmi≈ü istem formatƒ±**: ƒ∞ki konu≈ümacƒ±nƒ±n sesleri ve transkriptleri tek bir istem wav dosyasƒ±nda birle≈ütirilir:

Content:
- `wav_name` is the name of the output wav file.
- `prompt_transcription` is the transcription of the conversational prompt wav, e.g, "[S1] Hello. [S2] How are you?"
- `prompt_wav` is the path to the prompt wav.
- `text` is the text to be synthesized, e.g. "[S1] I'm fine. [S2] What's your name? [S1] I'm Eric. [S2] Hi Eric."

(2) **Splitted prompt format** where the audios and transciptions of two speakers exist in separate files:
Translation:
- `wav_name`, √ßƒ±ktƒ± wav dosyasƒ±nƒ±n adƒ±dƒ±r.
- `prompt_transcription`, konu≈üma istemi wav dosyasƒ±nƒ±n transkripsiyonudur, √∂rneƒüin, "[S1] Merhaba. [S2] Nasƒ±lsƒ±n?"
- `prompt_wav`, istem wav dosyasƒ±nƒ±n yoludur.
- `text`, sentezlenecek metindir, √∂rneƒüin, "[S1] ƒ∞yiyim. [S2] Adƒ±n ne? [S1] Ben Eric. [S2] Merhaba Eric."

(2) **B√∂l√ºnm√º≈ü istem formatƒ±**: iki konu≈ümacƒ±nƒ±n sesleri ve transkripsiyonlarƒ± ayrƒ± dosyalarda bulunur:

RowTranslations.originContent: - `wav_name` is the name of the output wav file.
- `prompt_transcription` is the transcription of the conversational prompt wav, e.g, "[S1] Hello. [S2] How are you?"
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `prompt_transcription`, konu≈üma istemi wav dosyasƒ±nƒ±n transkripsiyonudur, √∂rneƒüin, "[S1] Merhaba. [S2] Nasƒ±lsƒ±n?"

RowTranslations.originContent: - `prompt_wav` is the path to the prompt wav.
- `text` is the text to be synthesized, e.g. "[S1] I'm fine. [S2] What's your name? [S1] I'm Eric. [S2] Hi Eric."
RowTranslations.translatedContent: - `text`, sentezlenecek metindir, √∂rneƒüin, "[S1] ƒ∞yiyim. [S2] Adƒ±n ne? [S1] Ben Eric. [S2] Merhaba Eric."

RowTranslations.originContent: (2) **Splitted prompt format** where the audios and transciptions of two speakers exist in separate files:
RowTranslations.translatedContent: (2) **B√∂l√ºnm√º≈ü istem formatƒ±**: iki konu≈ümacƒ±nƒ±n sesleri ve transkripsiyonlarƒ± ayrƒ± dosyalarda bulunur:

Content:
- `wav_name` is the name of the output wav file.
- `spk1_prompt_transcription` is the transcription of the first speaker's prompt wav, e.g, "Hello"
- `spk2_prompt_transcription` is the transcription of the second speaker's prompt wav, e.g, "How are you?"
- `spk1_prompt_wav` is the path to the first speaker's prompt wav file.
- `spk2_prompt_wav` is the path to the second speaker's prompt wav file.
- `text` is the text to be synthesized, e.g. "[S1] I'm fine. [S2] What's your name? [S1] I'm Eric. [S2] Hi Eric."

### 3 Guidance for better usage:

#### 3.1 Prompt length

We recommand a short prompt wav file (e.g., less than 3 seconds for single-speaker speech generation, less than 10 seconds for dialogue speech generation) for faster inference speed. A very long prompt will slow down the inference and degenerate the speech quality.

#### 3.2 Speed optimization

If the inference speed is unsatisfactory, you can speed it up as follows:

- **Distill model and less steps**: For the single-speaker speech generation model, we use the `zipvoice` model by default for better speech quality. If faster speed is a priority, you can switch to the `zipvoice_distill` and can reduce the `--num-steps` to as low as `4` (8 by default).

- **CPU speedup with multi-threading**: When running on CPU, you can pass the `--num-thread` parameter (e.g., `--num-thread 4`) to increase the number of threads for faster speed. We use 1 thread by default.

- **CPU speedup with ONNX**: When running on CPU, you can use ONNX models with `zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_onnx` for faster speed (haven't supported ONNX for dialogue generation models yet). For even faster speed, you can further set `--onnx-int8 True` to use an INT8-quantized ONNX model. Note that the quantized model will result in a certain degree of speech quality degradation. **Don't use ONNX on GPU**, as it is slower than PyTorch on GPU.

#### 3.3 Memory control

The given text will be splitted into chunks based on punctuation (for single-speaker speech generation) or speaker-turn symbol (for dialogue speech generation). Then, the chunked texts will be processed in batches. Therefore, the model can process arbitrarily long text with almost constant memory usage. You can control memory usage by adjusting the `--max-duration` parameter.

#### 3.4 "Raw" evaluation

By default, we preprocess inputs (prompt wav, prompt transcription, and text) for efficient inference and better performance. If you want to evaluate the model‚Äôs "raw" performance using exact provided inputs (e.g., to reproduce the results in our paper), you can pass `--raw-evaluation True`.

#### 3.5 Short text

When generating speech for very short texts (e.g., one or two words), the generated speech may sometimes omit certain pronunciations. To resolve this issue, you can pass `--speed 0.3` (where 0.3 is a tunable value) to extend the duration of the generated speech.

#### 3.6 Correcting mispronounced chinese polyphone characters

We use [pypinyin](https://github.com/mozillazg/python-pinyin) to convert Chinese characters to pinyin. However, it can occasionally mispronounce **polyphone characters** (Â§öÈü≥Â≠ó).
Translation:
- `wav_name` √ßƒ±ktƒ± wav dosyasƒ±nƒ±n adƒ±dƒ±r.
- `spk1_prompt_transcription` birinci konu≈ümacƒ±nƒ±n prompt wav dosyasƒ±nƒ±n transkripsiyonudur, √∂rneƒüin, "Merhaba"
- `spk2_prompt_transcription` ikinci konu≈ümacƒ±nƒ±n prompt wav dosyasƒ±nƒ±n transkripsiyonudur, √∂rneƒüin, "Nasƒ±lsƒ±n?"
- `spk1_prompt_wav` birinci konu≈ümacƒ±nƒ±n prompt wav dosyasƒ±nƒ±n yoludur.
- `spk2_prompt_wav` ikinci konu≈ümacƒ±nƒ±n prompt wav dosyasƒ±nƒ±n yoludur.
- `text` sentezlenecek metindir, √∂rneƒüin, "[S1] ƒ∞yiyim. [S2] Adƒ±n ne? [S1] Ben Eric. [S2] Merhaba Eric."

### 3 Daha iyi kullanƒ±m i√ßin rehberlik:

#### 3.1 Prompt uzunluƒüu

Daha hƒ±zlƒ± √ßƒ±karƒ±m hƒ±zƒ± i√ßin kƒ±sa bir prompt wav dosyasƒ± √∂neriyoruz (√∂rneƒüin, tek konu≈ümacƒ±lƒ± konu≈üma √ºretimi i√ßin 3 saniyeden az, diyalog konu≈üma √ºretimi i√ßin 10 saniyeden az). √áok uzun bir prompt √ßƒ±karƒ±mƒ± yava≈ülatƒ±r ve konu≈üma kalitesini bozar.

#### 3.2 Hƒ±z optimizasyonu

Eƒüer √ßƒ±karƒ±m hƒ±zƒ± yeterli deƒüilse, a≈üaƒüƒ±daki ≈üekilde hƒ±zlandƒ±rabilirsiniz:

- **Distill model ve daha az adƒ±m**: Tek konu≈ümacƒ±lƒ± konu≈üma √ºretim modeli i√ßin, daha iyi konu≈üma kalitesi i√ßin varsayƒ±lan olarak `zipvoice` modelini kullanƒ±yoruz. Daha hƒ±zlƒ± bir hƒ±z √∂nceliƒüiniz ise, `zipvoice_distill` modeline ge√ßebilir ve `--num-steps` deƒüerini `4`'e kadar d√º≈ü√ºrebilirsiniz (varsayƒ±lan olarak 8).

- **CPU ile √ßoklu i≈ü par√ßacƒ±ƒüƒ± hƒ±zlandƒ±rmasƒ±**: CPU √ºzerinde √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±rken, daha hƒ±zlƒ± bir hƒ±z i√ßin `--num-thread` parametresini (√∂rneƒüin, `--num-thread 4`) ge√ßebilirsiniz. Varsayƒ±lan olarak 1 i≈ü par√ßacƒ±ƒüƒ± kullanƒ±yoruz.

- **ONNX ile CPU hƒ±zlandƒ±rmasƒ±**: CPU √ºzerinde √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±rken, daha hƒ±zlƒ± bir hƒ±z i√ßin `zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_onnx` ile ONNX modellerini kullanabilirsiniz (hen√ºz diyalog √ºretim modelleri i√ßin ONNX desteklenmiyor). Daha da hƒ±zlƒ± bir hƒ±z i√ßin, INT8-kuantize edilmi≈ü bir ONNX modeli kullanmak i√ßin `--onnx-int8 True` ayarlayabilirsiniz. Kuantize model konu≈üma kalitesinde belli bir bozulmaya yol a√ßacaktƒ±r. **GPU'da ONNX kullanmayƒ±n**, √ß√ºnk√º GPU'da PyTorch'tan daha yava≈ütƒ±r.

#### 3.3 Bellek kontrol√º

Verilen metin, noktalama i≈üaretlerine (tek konu≈ümacƒ±lƒ± konu≈üma √ºretimi i√ßin) veya konu≈ümacƒ± d√∂n√º≈ü√º sembol√ºne (diyalog konu≈üma √ºretimi i√ßin) g√∂re par√ßalara ayrƒ±lƒ±r. Sonra, par√ßalanmƒ±≈ü metinler toplu olarak i≈ülenir. Bu nedenle, model neredeyse sabit bellek kullanƒ±mƒ±yla sƒ±nƒ±rsƒ±z uzunlukta metni i≈üleyebilir. Bellek kullanƒ±mƒ±nƒ± `--max-duration` parametresini ayarlayarak kontrol edebilirsiniz.

#### 3.4 "Ham" deƒüerlendirme

Varsayƒ±lan olarak, girdileri (prompt wav, prompt transkripsiyonu ve metin) verimli √ßƒ±karƒ±m ve daha iyi performans i√ßin √∂n i≈üliyoruz. Modelin "ham" performansƒ±nƒ± tam olarak saƒülanan girdilerle deƒüerlendirmek isterseniz (√∂rneƒüin, makalemizdeki sonu√ßlarƒ± yeniden √ºretmek i√ßin), `--raw-evaluation True` parametresini ge√ßebilirsiniz.

#### 3.5 Kƒ±sa metin

√áok kƒ±sa metinler i√ßin konu≈üma √ºretirken (√∂rneƒüin, bir veya iki kelime), √ºretilen konu≈üma bazen bazƒ± telaffuzlarƒ± atlayabilir. Bu sorunu √ß√∂zmek i√ßin, √ºretilen konu≈ümanƒ±n s√ºresini uzatmak i√ßin `--speed 0.3` (burada 0.3 ayarlanabilir bir deƒüerdir) parametresini kullanabilirsiniz.

#### 3.6 Yanlƒ±≈ü telaffuz edilen √áince √ßok sesli karakterleri d√ºzeltme

√áince karakterleri pinyin'e d√∂n√º≈üt√ºrmek i√ßin [pypinyin](https://github.com/mozillazg/python-pinyin) kullanƒ±yoruz. Ancak, bazen **√ßok sesli karakterleri** (Â§öÈü≥Â≠ó) yanlƒ±≈ü telaffuz edebilir.

RowTranslations.originContent: We recommand a short prompt wav file (e.g., less than 3 seconds for single-speaker speech generation, less than 10 seconds for dialogue speech generation) for faster inference speed. A very long prompt will slow down the inference and degenerate the speech quality.

RowTranslations.originContent: - **Distill model and less steps**: For the single-speaker speech generation model, we use the `zipvoice` model by default for better speech quality. If faster speed is a priority, you can switch to the `zipvoice_distill` and can reduce the `--num-steps` to as low as `4` (8 by default).

RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **CPU ile √ßoklu i≈ü par√ßacƒ±ƒüƒ± hƒ±zlandƒ±rmasƒ±**: CPU √ºzerinde √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±rken, daha hƒ±zlƒ± bir hƒ±z i√ßin `--num-thread` parametresini (√∂rneƒüin, `--num-thread 4`) ge√ßebilirsiniz. Varsayƒ±lan olarak 1 i≈ü par√ßacƒ±ƒüƒ± kullanƒ±yoruz.

RowTranslations.originContent: - **CPU speedup with multi-threading**: When running on CPU, you can pass the `--num-thread` parameter (e.g., `--num-thread 4`) to increase the number of threads for faster speed. We use 1 thread by default.

RowTranslations.translatedContent: - **ONNX ile CPU hƒ±zlandƒ±rmasƒ±**: CPU √ºzerinde √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±rken, daha hƒ±zlƒ± bir hƒ±z i√ßin `zipvoice.bin.infer_zipvoice_onnx` ile ONNX modellerini kullanabilirsiniz (hen√ºz diyalog √ºretim modelleri i√ßin ONNX desteklenmiyor). Note that the quantized model will result in a certain degree of speech quality degradation. **Don't use ONNX on GPU**, as it is slower than PyTorch on GPU.

√áince karakterleri pinyin'e d√∂n√º≈üt√ºrmek i√ßin [pypinyin](https://github.com/mozillazg/python-pinyin) kullanƒ±yoruz. Ancak, bazen **√ßok sesli karakterleri** (Â§öÈü≥Â≠ó) yanlƒ±≈ü telaffuz edebilir.

RowTranslations.originContent: We use [pypinyin](https://github.com/mozillazg/python-pinyin) to convert Chinese characters to pinyin. However, it can occasionally mispronounce **polyphone characters** (Â§öÈü≥Â≠ó).

Content:
To manually correct these mispronunciations, enclose the **corrected pinyin** in angle brackets `< >` and include the **tone mark**.

**Example:**

- Original text: `ËøôÊääÂâëÈïø‰∏âÂçÅÂÖ¨ÂàÜ`
- Correct the pinyin of `Èïø`:  `ËøôÊääÂâë<chang2>‰∏âÂçÅÂÖ¨ÂàÜ`

> **Note:** If you want to manually assign multiple pinyins, enclose each pinyin with `<>`, e.g., `ËøôÊää<jian4><chang2><san1>ÂçÅÂÖ¨ÂàÜ`

#### 3.7 Remove long silences from the generated speech

Model will automatically determine the positions and lengths of silences in the generated speech. It occasionally has long silence in the middle of the speech. If you don't want this, you can pass `--remove-long-sil` to remove long silences in the middle of the generated speech (edge silences will be removed by default).

#### 3.8 Model downloading

If you have trouble connecting to HuggingFace when downloading the pre-trained models, try switching endpoint to the mirror site: `export HF_ENDPOINT=https://hf-mirror.com`.

## Train Your Own Model

See the [egs](egs) directory for training, fine-tuning and evaluation examples.

## C++ Deployment

Check [sherpa-onnx](https://github.com/k2-fsa/sherpa-onnx/pull/2487#issuecomment-3227884498) for the C++ deployment solution on CPU.

## Discussion & Communication

You can directly discuss on [Github Issues](https://github.com/k2-fsa/ZipVoice/issues).

You can also scan the QR code to join our wechat group or follow our wechat official account.
